org.docheinstein.mp3doctor.ui.main

Class MainWindowController

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.docheinstein.mp3doctor.ui.main.MainWindowController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ListListener<Playlist>, ObservableListListener<Playlist>, PlaylistProvider, PlayableSongProvider, PlayableSongQueueProvider, SongPlayer.SongPlayerListener, SongListProvider, SongProvider, SongSelectionProvider, SongViewer, RootController, StageAware, SongPlayerHandler

    public class MainWindowController
extends java.lang.Object
implements RootController, SongPlayerHandler, SongPlayer.SongPlayerListener, ObservableListListener<Playlist>, PlayableSongQueueProvider, PlaylistProvider, SongListProvider, SongProvider, SongSelectionProvider, SongViewer
    Main window and controller of the application that is responsible for:
    • Embed a controller which is the main controller of the application
    • Show the menus and allow to use those with shortcuts
    • Show a row for each category the use can navigate to (e.g. Genres, Years, Songs, ...).
    • Show a row for each existing playlist and let the user navigate it.
    • Play a song queue provided by an embedded controller.

    This controller always embeds a controller that changes when the user select a different category.

    The philosophy of the controller is being a bridge through the actions the user can request with MenuItemActions and the embedded controller.

    For this reason, this class implements every interface that any possible embedded controller implements.

    For instance, this controller implements SongViewer, although it is not able to show a song by itself; for these reason this controller asks to the current controller to do so (the embedded controller should be of the type required for execute the action required).

      Entity that represents a category which essentially is a controller MainWindowController.Category.mController and its view MainWindowController.Category.mNode.

        Description copied from interface: ListListener
        Called when elements are added to the list.

        If multiple items are added at the same time (e.g. with List.addAll(int, Collection) this method is called just once for all the elements.

      • onElementsChanged

        public void onElementsChanged(java.util.List<? extends Playlist> playlists)
        Description copied from interface: ObservableListListener
        Called when elements are updated in the list.

        The changes to the list's elements are detected via the Observable interface which is implemented by the elements.

        If multiple items are updated at the same time (e.g. with List.replaceAll(UnaryOperator) this method is called just once for all the elements.

        Specified by:
        onElementsChanged in interface ObservableListListener<Playlist>
        Parameters:
        playlists - the changed elements

      • addPlaylist

        private void addPlaylist(java.lang.String playlistName)
        Adds the given playlist to (PlaylistsManager if it doesn't exist yet.

        This method doesn't directly update the UI, it will be updated by the callback we receive from the PlaylistsManager.

        Parameters:
        playlistName - name of the playlist
